siteMetadata.name: Talha Enes Ayranci
siteMetadata.title: Talha Enes Ayranci
siteMetadata.description: PhD Candidate in Computer Science at the University of Glasgow.
siteMetadata.about:
I am a second-year PhD student in Computing Science at the University of Glasgow, under the supervision of Jonathan Grizou and Mireilla Bikanga Ada. My research focuses on educational robotics.
            
Apart from research, I like writing blogs, watching and playing football and exploring the beautiful places of Scotland. I also have a beginner's level interest in the philosophy of science.
siteMetadata.author: talhayranci

markdownRemark.excerpt: During my MSc program, our team worked together to create a robot soccer simulation in the Webots robotics simulation environment. Our group consisted of six…
markdownRemark.html:
During my MSc program, our team worked together to create a robot soccer simulation in the Webots robotics simulation environment. Our group consisted of six individuals with various academic backgrounds, which brought a diverse set of perspectives to the project. In this simulation, we organized exciting 4 vs. 4 soccer matches, with each team employing different strategies and techniques to play the game. The entire project was coded using the Python programming language, highlighting Python’s flexibility and effectiveness in the field of robotics and artificial intelligence.

You can find the project repo here.

frontmatter.title: Mobile and Simulation Based Self-Driving Car
